noun.description: A native or inhabitant of Pergamum.

adjective.description: Of or relating to Pergamum, the school of sculpture that flourished there in the 3rd and 2nd centuries b.c., or the early Christian Church founded in the city.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas North (1535–?1603), translator. From classical Latin Pergamēnus Pergamene + -ian, originally via Middle French Pergamenien.
